name: Plank
short description: The plank is a core stabilization exercise that also targets your arms and shoulders.
short explanation: Get into a push-up position and hold your body straight from head to heels.
long explanation: Lie face down then lift yourself up onto your elbows and toes. Keep your back flat and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold this position while keeping your abdominal muscles tight to avoid sagging hips.

name: Kettlebell Swing
short explanation: Kettlebell swings are a dynamic exercise targeting the legs, glutes, and back, enhancing power and endurance.
long explanation: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, swing a kettlebell between your legs and then thrust it up to chest height.
column8: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell with both hands. Bend your knees slightly and swing the kettlebell between your legs. Forcefully thrust your hips forward and swing the kettlebell up to chest height, then let it swing back between your legs.

name: Hip Thrust
short description: Hip thrusts specifically target the glute muscles for strength and size enhancement.
short explanation: Sit on the ground with a weight bench behind you, place your upper back against the bench, and push your hips up.
long explanation: Sit on the ground with your back against a bench and a barbell over your hips. Plant your feet firmly on the ground and push your hips upwards, fully extending your hips at the top while squeezing your glutes. Lower back down after a brief pause.

name: Burpees
short description: Burpees are a high-intensity full-body exercise that improves strength, agility, and endurance.
short explanation: Begin in a standing position, drop into a squat with hands on the ground, then kick back into a push-up position, return to squat and jump up.
long explanation: Start standing, then lower into a squat with your hands on the floor. Kick your feet back into a push-up position and perform a push-up. Quickly return your feet to the squat position and jump up explosively.

name: Farmers Walk
short description: Farmers walks build muscle and strength in the shoulders, traps, and grip while improving endurance.
short explanation: Grab a pair of heavy dumbbells, hold them at your sides and walk a specific distance.
long explanation: Pick up a pair of dumbbells or kettlebells, stand up straight, and walk a designated distance or until you can no longer maintain your grip. Keep your shoulders back and your core engaged throughout.

name: Mountain Climbers
short description: Mountain climbers are a cardio exercise that also targets the core and upper body.
short explanation: Start in a plank position and alternate driving your knees towards your chest rapidly.
long explanation: Begin in a push-up position with your arms straight. Quickly draw one knee towards your chest and return it to the starting position, then switch to the other knee. Continue alternating rapidly.

name: Reverse Lunges
short explanation: Reverse lunges strengthen the legs and glutes with a focus on balance and coordination.
long explanation: Stand with feet hip-width apart, step backward with one leg and lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.
column8: Start standing, then step back with one foot. Lower your hips so that your rear knee nears the floor while your front thigh is parallel to the floor. Ensure your front knee stays above the ankle and doesn't push too far forward.

name: Calf Raises
short description: Calf raises are a straightforward exercise targeting the calf muscles for improved strength and mobility.
short explanation: Stand on the edge of a step with heels hanging off, push up onto your toes and lower back down.
long explanation: Stand on a step with your heels hanging off the edge. Push up onto your tiptoes, hold for a moment, and then lower back down below the step to stretch your calves.

name: Wall Sit
short description: Wall sits are a static exercise that improves endurance and strength in the lower body.
short explanation: Slide your back down a wall until your thighs are parallel to the ground and hold the position.
long explanation: Lean back against a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and about two feet from the wall. Slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle and hold this position.

name: Tuck Jumps
short description: Tuck jumps are a high-impact exercise that improves leg power and cardiovascular fitness.
short explanation: Perform a squat, jump up explosively and pull your knees to your chest, then land softly.
long explanation: Start in a squat position, explode upwards and pull your knees towards your chest while jumping. Land softly and go back into a squat to prepare for the next jump.
